page.title: 06HOMES IN BRIGG
page.content:
A survey of children in our school established that of the 2O8 children interviewed seventy five live in a detached house, sixty five in a semi-detached house, forty seven in a terraced house and seventeen in a detached bungalow. One lives in a flat and one in a semi detached bungalow and two children live in a childrens' home
The average size of a home was calculated on the number of bedrooms. Fifteen children live in two bedroom property, one hundred and thirty seven in a three bedroom, forty three in a four or more bedroom property. Nearly three quarters said their family had moved at least twice. Half of the families had moved into Brigg from another area. This is possibly due to the relatively cheap housing.
